data.Name: Centrifuge Gas Water
data.Description: This method involves using a centrifuge to apply high-speed rotational forces to a rock sample saturated with fluid. The centrifugal force drives the fluid through the rock's pore network, allowing for the measurement of permeability and fluid saturation properties under varying pressures and saturations that simulate subsurface conditions.

data.Name: Flood Oil Water
data.Description: The flood method, often referred to as flooding or flow testing, involves injecting fluids (water, oil, or gas) into a rock sample at controlled rates and pressures.

data.Name: Flood Gas
data.Description: The flood method, often referred to as flooding or flow testing, involves injecting fluids (water, oil, or gas) into a rock sample at controlled rates and pressures.

data.Name: Flood Oil
data.Description: The flood method, often referred to as flooding or flow testing, involves injecting fluids (water, oil, or gas) into a rock sample at controlled rates and pressures.

data.Name: Porous Plate Gas Water
data.Description: In the porous plate method, a rock sample is placed on a porous ceramic plate connected to a water reservoir. The capillary pressure required to force water into the rock pores is measured as water moves through the plate into the sample.

data.Name: Porous Plate Gas Water Oil
